meanings.definition: A compound found in garlic that has antibacterial properties.
meanings.sent1: Allicins are natural substances in garlic that can fight bacteria.
meanings.sent2: I read that allicins in garlic can help kill harmful germs.
meanings.sent3: Why did the bacteria refuse to go near the allicins? Because they knew they couldn't win the fight!
meanings.sent4: The allicins in garlic acted like tiny warriors, battling the bacteria invading the body.
meanings.sent5: The powerful allicins in garlic are like nature's own antibiotic, protecting us from infections.

meanings.definition: The plural form of allicin, a sulfur-containing compound in garlic.
meanings.sent1: She added allicins to the recipe to enhance the garlic flavor.
meanings.sent2: The dish called for two cloves of garlic, so I used allicins instead.
meanings.sent3: Why did the allicins throw a party? Because they heard garlic was coming to town!
meanings.sent4: The kitchen smelled like a garden of allicins, filling the air with their pungent aroma.
meanings.sent5: As I chopped the allicins, their distinct smell reminded me of the delicious garlic bread I love.
